intro: Nemophila menziesii subsp. insignis, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and meadows. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and is part of the Violaceae family. Due to its habitat specificity, it is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates.
